DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Donor Relationship Specify Relationship
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a free text field to specify information related to the relationship or state of connectedness of the donor of primitive hematopoietic stem cells, blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.), for use in recipient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant Donor Relationship
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the relationship or state of connectedness of the donor of primitive hematopoietic stem cells, blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.), for use in recipient.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
